hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Volatility Compression Reversal
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a significant negative news catalyst (e.g., major liquidation event, regulatory headline) that causes a sharp 1-hour price drop (>3%) on elevated volume (>150% of 20-day avg), the subsequent 4-hour period will exhibit mean-reverting price action as short-term panic selling exhausts, providing a long entry edge.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Sharp negative news often triggers algorithmic and emotional selling that overshoots fair value. In neutral/bull regimes, this creates a liquidity vacuum that is quickly filled by value buyers and arbitrage bots once panic subsides, especially when evidenced by negative funding rates (traders paying to be short).
entry_conditions: BTC 1-hour close >3% below previous close on volume >150% of 20-day average
4-hour RSI(14) enters oversold territory (<30) within 2 hours of the news spike
Funding rates turn negative (perpetual futures) indicating excessive bearish sentiment
Price stabilizes above the low of the initial spike candle for 1 consecutive hour

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 50% of the initial news-driven drop
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price breaks below the low of the initial spike candle by 0.5%
exit_conditions.time_exit: 24 hours after entry if neither TP nor SL hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 55% of such setups continue trending downward beyond the initial spike low within 24 hours, indicating the catalyst reveals structural weakness rather than transient panic.
